website_summaries.verdict: A low-priced faucet with a few known (but rare) flaws.
pros: Sleek design at a good price

customer_reviews.title: Nozzle dangles loosely and sloppy - good otherwise
customer_reviews.text: The nozzle lacks a magnet or other mechanism to hold it to the neck, so often it just hangs loosely and sloppily. A round magnet on the neck would be so perfect - it seems crazy that they wouldn't have something to hold the nozzle head to the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Jill J Stein

customer_reviews.title: Ordered on December 22, 2015, no idea why ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on December 22, 2015, no idea why but this thing has completely failed within 10 months. Technically I installed it about 5 months ago but the purchase was almost 10 months ago. (see picture) Will update my experience after I submit my warranty claim.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn C. Ridnour

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase - classie - go get yours!!!
customer_reviews.text: This order come to us in good time and very well packaged for it's long journey to us (no issues there!). This very useful faucet is way beyond its simple structure than it appears! The seating is standard - "Standard Hardware" so it connected and took its place very easily on the sink. The head swivels from left to right easily and the hose pulls out to deliver water a good way beyond the kitchen-sink; as well as to deliver a spray and or full spouting water pressure. The single 'water-lever' accesses hot, cold and tepid water to our/your desired temperature. The finish is classic "SH" - high buffed, stainless steel finish.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and the pull out spray head is very convenient. Happy after 8 months of use,
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this item for 8 months and am pleased with its performance. This is my first faucet with the pull out spray head and my only regret is that I didn't get one like this sooner. This particular one appears to be made for a fairly large sink, front to back. For my sink, I would prefer the neck have more of a bend so the water came out directly over the drain. But this has not been an issue- you get used to it quickly. The handle can be aimed in any direction when installing, and mine is forward instead of to the side as shown in the ad - seems more convenient to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Adams

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, massive leak in just 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage, the faucet started leaking badly in just 3 years with normal usage. I have come to learn American Standard brand is the lowest quality brand you can possible get, every single hardware and toilet i bought for my whole house renovation just 3 years ago that are american standard have developed major issues, meanwhile kohler and other brand items all worked perfectly. Avoid this brand at all cost, or you will regret it later.
customer_reviews.author: gaga

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these faucets and both have failed. The hose, where it connects to sprayer, developed a pin hole in both faucets within a year. Replaced both, then pinhole developed again within 9 months. I emailed American Standard and asked if these faucets had a defect. They claimed no, but many of the FAQs on their page complain of the same problem. American Standard did send me 2 more hoses several months ago and the new hose is leaking already. I'm going to end up replacing the whole faucet with Kohler.
customer_reviews.author: efmb

customer_reviews.title: Classic, functional - I enjoy using it every time!
customer_reviews.text: It replaced an old pull-down kitchen faucet that was a total frustration. This new faucet is such a pleasure to use compared to my previous one I actually enjoy turning on the faucet. A plumber installed it, but it did not seem hard to install. The water flow is perfect, the pull-out always retracts perfectly, the arch of the faucet is so versatile and handy, and it looks GREAT in my kitchen. I highly recommend it as a kitchen faucet - very good value, very functional, high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Papken

customer_reviews.title: The head will not fully retract back into the faucet stem but call center is very helpful
customer_reviews.text: The head will not fully retract back into the curved stem of the faucet. I called and they briskly sent out an additional weight to install on the hose underneath the counter to help with full retraction. It is an attractive kitchen faucet design.
customer_reviews.author: dh

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy high quality faucet
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice faucet. I put this in a room over the garage so I was not looking for anything too expensive. I think the cost is very reasonable considering the quality which I would rate excellent. Install was extremely easy. Tighten everything before turning the water on. I thought the faucet hoses were tight from the factory - turns out they were not. The faucet will not auto-retract - you need to push it back in - it will not fall out on its own if the weight is properly installed.
customer_reviews.author: D. P. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Good faucet for the price, still going strong after almost a year.
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like about this faucet? The pull out neck is a good length and fully retracts when finished(vs some faucets that don't have a heavy enough counter weight). No drips or leaks even after a year of use. The stainless steel hasn't shown any signs of rust. Installation was pretty standard and typical with all the piping fitting through a standard sink faucet drill out. The only downside is is it uses 1/2 inch pipe hoses instead 3/4 inch hoses so the flow rate is lower than my previous faucet the this replaces.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and it works!  Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This faucet is beautiful and functional! We bought this to replace our original builder-grade faucet that was leaking horribly. We did hire someone to install it, but he said it was pretty standard and easy. We've had it a couple of months now, and my husband says it's one of the best things I've bought on Amazon so far (which is saying a lot, considering how much we shop on Amazon). I love this faucet, and it's worked beautifully so far. My only complaint is that we somehow lost the little hot/cold indicator. There's probably a way to get a replacement for it, but so far it hasn't caused any issues and is mainly cosmetic.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Short life span, worked for only 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this faucet in July 2016, for 1.5 years it worked well, then it suddenly lost hot water pressure. After fully testing our hot water supply and connection hoses (we don’t have a mineral water problem), which had perfect hot water pressure, we determined the problem to be the faucet valve. That valve is inaccessible to repair, so frustratingly, we are out the money and have no working faucet. Such a short time to function, really disappointed in it as an American Standard product. Going to purchase next one at Costco to protect my purchase dollars from waste, at least they stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: LovesCoffee

customer_reviews.title: Overall: This is my second time installing this faucet in a kitchen, this faucet is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace existing wobbly old faucet. I had it installed in under an hour. Just be sure to pull the pull out, and twist the connection threatening nice and tight. Looks pretty and is nice and solid. Overall: This is my second time installing this faucet in a kitchen, this faucet is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Blackthorpe

customer_reviews.title: The hose inside the braided line on the pull out sprayer only lasted a couple of years.
customer_reviews.text: The hose inside the braided line on the pull out sprayer only lasted a couple of years then began to leak everywhere. Probably could have gotten a new hose but decided to replace it entire thing instead. I hated that the sprayer would stay on after the water was shut off and then unexpectedly spray you when you turned the water on.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Good but some design flaws in the head.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking faucet. Very easy to install. One design flaw is a plastic ring that holds the head of the faucet does not stay in place. I unscrewed the head to install a rubber band around this plastic piece hoping to get it to stay. The hose immediately dropped into the faucet casing because I had failed to undo the weights. I then had to uninstall the entire faucet in order to fish out the coupling which had become stuck in the base of the casing. A real pain, but I did it. So, I recommend the faucet but hope the company improves this design flaw so that users do not need to rig it with homemade solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Helen F

customer_reviews.title: My contractor says this is every bit as good.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a kitchen remodel. My contractor agreed that this faucet is every bit as good as the $300-400 varieties. It has a handy pull down, high gooseneck, looks very attractive. It also has the highest rate of flow in its class. So I have had it about a month and so far so good. I will update if any problems arise.
customer_reviews.author: S. Plencner

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I am up and running for two months now and we have no problems with this. Looks good, kids kind of complained about the fan spray from the new, taller height over our sink splashing outside the sink but all that means is don't switch to fan vs stream without holding closer to the surface.
customer_reviews.author: R.P.-MN

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking faucet. The water pressure is not as good as my previous faucet but it is acceptable. I didn't have a spray model before so I don't know if it's typical to have lower pressure with these types of faucets. I did not install it with the included plate since I wanted to install a soap pump next to the faucet. The only complaint I have is that the bottom of the faucet does not sit flush with the sink and I'm worried the little gap there will get grime in it. Other than that it looks great and I am very glad I purchased the faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: and then when my Mom moved to her new place and hated her kitchen faucet
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two - one for me, and then when my Mom moved to her new place and hated her kitchen faucet, I surprised her with one. We both love them. The price is absolutely unreal for the quality of this thing - it doesn't feel flimsy and it performs well. The inner cable isn't metal, which I like. It hasn't leaked, which was a problem with our previous metal one. I don't love that the head isn't metal (it's plastic) but honestly, we had an all metal one previously that cost us way more and was a disaster (leaks, breaking, etc). This is definitely a good quality piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria R

customer_reviews.title: Love this faucet!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this faucet!! It is almost all metal. The sprayer head is plastic but still great quality. Very, very easy install. I was very pleased at how simple and smooth the install was. All parts are made of good construction, brass and stainless fittings. Sprayer is very smooth, and the mixer is accurate and easy to adjust. And, to top it all off, this faucet is much better quality than what is found in the big hardware stores. To match this quality in a brick and mortar store one would have to spend $300 or more.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Less than 1 year, developed lack of water pressure (flow). Mount is loose also.
customer_reviews.text: Water flow issue is because cartridge becomes loose internally and slips to cover incoming flow. Once you attempt to adjust it the mount becomes loose. So you get a cycle of continuous adjusting. I'm probably going to replace the entire cartridge and see what becomes of this. Less than average use in household. Bought as a lightning deal, saving approx $40 off current price. Cartridge is priced at $15. I can take this thing apart and reinstall in my sleep now. I'll update.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Johns

customer_reviews.title: Watch the thread on the faucet head
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking facuet. We dicovered one minor issue. If the tip of the head is not screwed in tightly it shoots water back down the housing. After severl days the head came slghtly loose. Our snowbirds use the faucet without pulling it down and shot water inside the housing into the cabinet below. THey contacte dus to say we had a kitched sink leak. I drove over to investigate and after drying everything down i could not fins any leaks. So i asked my wife to turn the faucet on and sure enough the water came down through the housing.I tightened the thread asbest possible without tape. Will wait to see it if works loose.
customer_reviews.author: SimonB

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: After much research as to price, manufacturer, and pondering on plastic parts vs metal, etc, I finally wound up with this as my choice. Yes, the Moen and Delta were at the head of my top picks; however comma...this was my choice. Can't tell you how happy I am for it. Great product. So much so that I bought another one for a friend as a house warming gift who recently bought a house, but kitchen faucet developed a big leak soon after. Now they're happy, too.
customer_reviews.author: Papa-san

customer_reviews.title: Great price, clean lines, it works
customer_reviews.text: I've used this faucet for about a month now, and I would definitely recommend it for the clean lines and the great price here (much cheaper than anything at the big box home improvement stores). Most importantly, it works. The spray head has no problem retracting when the weight is installed correctly, and although sometimes it doesn't go quite back in all the way, it's no problem to just give it a little push. It was easy to install; the hard part was getting out the old one that had too much mineral build up.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Sleek
customer_reviews.text: Not too difficult to install. It sure looks pretty. I installed it lefty and it works fine. I took the counterweight from my old pullout hose and bolted it on in line with the new counterweight that came with the new faucet. Now the hose retracts with some authority. I would buy this again but hopefully it will last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Donald G Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Great looking Kitcen Faucet
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this faucet for many months now and am very pleased with the looks and performance. The chrome is flawless and resists spotting. The mounting plate is sturdy and of good chrome finish also.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Huff

customer_reviews.title: Bad deal
customer_reviews.text: I've had this faucet less than 6 months and noticed a sudden drop in water pressure. The hoses connecting to the faucet (it came assembled) had sprung multiple leaks and flooded my cabinet. Now I get to pay for a new faucet and installation since this is outside the return window. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Maisch

customer_reviews.title: High flow faucet.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. My old faucet had a water restrictor built in. Took forever to fill anything. This is a high flow faucet that really works. Can't believe the difference, sooo much faster to fill or spray anything. Going from a 2 knob to a single knob took a little getting used to, but now wife and I both love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about purchasing a stainless faucet at the bottom price point for this style of faucet.Those concerns went away as I easily installed the American Standard Colony Kitchen Faucet. Installation was easy with color coded hoses and a three screw tightening system that really secures the faucet. I added the hose weight from my old faucet when installing as some reviews said the hose did not return completely, I have had no issues here. The faucet has a quality finish and feel. Overall I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Al Parranto

customer_reviews.title: At Last a Kitchen Faucet That Works!
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen faucet was installed by my husband as a surprise since our old faucet was not working efficiently. It's a wonderful addition to our kitchen and is a dream to use. The raised faucet allows ease when filling large pots or buckets without having to fill with the pull down hose. The pull down hose has either a spray or stream capability. The handle adjusts to various speeds and water power. After replacing two previous faucets (by well known manufacturers) in fifteen years we finally found a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Yorkie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, good price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice unit. Strong, aerated stream or strong spray. Swivel capability and spray removal the main reason we bought this unit. Easy to install. Only gripe - the unit came unsecured in the mfgrs box. During transit, the unit bounced around. The water connections are plastic lines with metal braiding overall. No supports where added where the braided plastic lines entered the faucet body, and the movement of the unit during shipping resulted in the braiding being somewhat crimped at that point. Not bad enough to damage the plastic line (I think) but noticeably crimped. Some simple, removable support at that point would have been good.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L.A.

customer_reviews.title: seems solid
customer_reviews.text: Well made, solid design. Pretty good looking. Works well so far. The spray head retracts fine, with the weight properly located under the sink. The water supply hoses seem kind of flimsy, but that shouldn't be an issue if you're careful with the install.
customer_reviews.author: matteo

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long, water pressure too weak
customer_reviews.text: Need to replaced faucet cartridge only after less than couple years of service. Plastic material cracked. Water pressure is too weak, takes longer than normal time to fill up a cooking pot. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Gong Wing Louie

customer_reviews.title: Flow problems with replacement as well as original. Spare yourself the headache.
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, but the 1st one we had had an issue with flow. They sent us a replacement that lasted 6 months but began having flow issues. It's to expensive to last just 6 months. Plus side, it was easy to install (twice). Clearly there is a design flaw, if the 1st one never flowed properly and the 2nd only lasted 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: dogger

customer_reviews.title: I love this faucet in all ways except one
customer_reviews.text: I love this faucet in all ways except one. When the water is on high and the faucet is on spray (instead of stream) it sends out a very hard spray that ends up getting water all over the front of the sink that has to be wiped off every time we do the dishes or something. I am considering drilling out the spray holes to see if I can relieve some of the pressure behind the spray nozzle and take away some of the pressure in the water. Not sure if that will work but I am going to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Big Joe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.....once old faucet is out.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this American Standard faucet in about 15 minutes, once I had the old faucet taken out. What a pleasure it was, clearly marked parts, thoughtful design for us non mechanical types. By far the hardest part was removing the old rusty faucet. I will buy this brand again
customer_reviews.author: C Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great except the leaking
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and functional. After two years inner hose started leaking then started spraying. The rubber gets little pin size holes. They really need to improve the hose.
customer_reviews.author: bonna bing

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, functional, faucet - and a tremendous value!
customer_reviews.text: I installed two of these in the kitchen at our lake place... purchased them locally, there, at one of the big-box home improvement stores: for half-again as much each! Same faucet! We loved them there so when my wife started complaining about the kitchen faucet at our cabin, I thought I'd check Amazon. To my astonishment I found this faucet among the listings. You can't go wrong, here. Fully functional, a great price, simple installation (required: a Philips screwdriver, an adjustable wrench, and a wad of plumber's putty), quick delivery, and American Standard's lifetime finish and function warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Creedeco

customer_reviews.title: Sold defective goods
customer_reviews.text: This product began to leak and totally fell apart less than four months after we purchased it. We bought it in April and the return period closed the next month. This was a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna T.

customer_reviews.title: I loved it for the first year
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a little over a year and a half. I loved it for the first year, then the hose began to spring leaks! Now I have to have it repaired or replaced! Very aggravated!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Faucet, Attractive Looks & Functional
customer_reviews.text: Good quality faucet. Installation was easy One thing to note is if your water lines are far from the sink you may have to buy additional hoses as the hose that came with it did not initially reach. However I won't dock points for that because I think a longer hose would have been inconvenient for most set ups. Excellent service from American Standard as well, as I was missing some parts and contacted them. They sent it out right away.
customer_reviews.author: S. Savara

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install but the water hook up lines are ...
customer_reviews.text: Received when promised. It was easy to install but the water hook up lines are too short. I had to go to home depot and purchase extensions. I like the faucet and hopefully will give me years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good Faucet for the Price
customer_reviews.text: It has a great high flow. I don't understand why people go for the "low flow" to save water, you can always just turn the faucet down and have high flow when you need it. Overall good quality, no leaking so far, and the hose returns fairly easily. You do need to make sure the hose below is free and the weight is in the right place. The only I do not like is the spray selector doesn't always reset back to normal, but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Bracken

customer_reviews.title: Nice faucet
customer_reviews.text: I really like this faucet. My husband has some plumbing experience, so he was able to do things himself and he reported no complaints or missing part. He said it went very easy. The look of it is outstanding. I like the ease of the button to switch to the spray, which by the way is so strong, you can feel the mist rising out of the sink. It power washes old stuff off the dishes with ease. The hose retracts back into the housing easily. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Arya Stark

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I had this professionally installed by a licensed plumber and he stated that it was a great product and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Laslie

customer_reviews.title: Works and Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: I have had this install (by a plumber so I can't speak of ease if installation) for about two months and I love it. I am still getting used to not reaching for a separate spray nozzle though! For our kitchen remodel I wanted something bold and classy. I looked at all the much more expensive kitchen faucets in this style...too expensive and they didn't have the high ratings this one does. I bought it in chrome and it goes beautifully with the granite countertops, I think!
customer_reviews.author: E Trexler

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Solid Unit - Won Me Over
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding unit. I was hesitant since I knew the head was going to be made of plastic. I am more than impressed. The overall unit is solid with lots of metal throughout. Will the head fail sooner than one made of metal? Possibly. But for the price, I am more than happy to give this one a shot. Installed easily. Looks beautiful. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Tito

customer_reviews.title: Package arrived without necessary parts to complete job.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived without all the parts, probably was a returned product that had not been carefully checked. Plumber arrived to install sink and this faucet and found parts to be missing such that we had to run out to Home Depot and buy new faucet for him to install otherwise waste this service visit. Extremely annoying.
customer_reviews.author: kjporter

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze and it works just as you would expect it to. The great thing about this faucet is how inexpensive it was compared to similar faucets and the quality seems to be just as good. We had a standard kitchen faucet before and now that we've installed this one, we don't know how we ever lived without one. I've specifically recommended it to some family members who are in the process of building a house.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Telegdy

customer_reviews.title: Simple functionality, good-quality button/switch, looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation, great function. The hose and head work better than several other extendable faucets I've had over the past 10 years. This one is very nice looking, doesn't smudge easily, and feels great -- the faucet handle moves smoothly and has nice start-stop points. The button on the head to switch between stream and shower is solid and stays where you put it. The head notches into place nicely, and doesn't droop or slip out. Overall a great piece.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Ivey

customer_reviews.title: performance is poor!
customer_reviews.text: the water flow is terribly restricted. my water pressure is fine in the rest of the house so that is not the issue . the faucet is very quality but I am thinking of returning item is I cannot solve this problem
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for my kitchen sink. Only downside is if you turn on faucet and the sprayer is on you can have water splatter everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth E Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Looks and performs quite well.
customer_reviews.text: Only installed two months ago, but this faucet looks and performs very well. The pull out head stays in place and the faucet has good flow/volume. In fact, when set to spray there is some overspray - but this is a result of such a strong stream. This may not be the best faucet you can buy, but the quality and functionality for the price seems hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: A fellow named Bob

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations. Quality solid faucet
customer_reviews.text: I received the faucet and was pleasantly surprised with its quality. It is not a flimsy fixture and was quite large. The only issue I had was in the installation as the plumber had to make several adjustments to fit it using the old angle valves. The plumber also had to turn the handle to the front rather than to the side, but this isn't a major issue. It's definitely value for money and looks gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: odecca gibson

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and functional
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this faucet in stainless and also in black matte to compare in my kitchen. I kept the stainless because it looks better with my countertop and sink but the black matte is very nice looking too. The installation looks simple and I could have done it myself but couldn't get the old faucet off and had to call the plumber. He installed the pull-down with the control knobs facing out which doesn't look as sleek as in the photo on amazon but is more comfortable to control with my thumb.
customer_reviews.author: desiree

customer_reviews.title: Easy for a novice.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and simple to install. I've never installed a faucet before and this only took me 20-25 minutes to complete by myself. I installed this with the Franke USA Black Composite Granite Offset sink, and the two really look good together. Put this in a house that I am getting ready to sell and will definitely purchase this model again if my new home needs an upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Just L

customer_reviews.title: Great Faucet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Faucet for the money. It came in good shape and was easy to install. It’s got great water pressure also
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth s.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, and will last a long time. Great price point!
customer_reviews.text: We've been remodeling/updating my mother-in-law's kitchen and the leaky faucet was not cutting it. We aren't upgrading the counter-top or sink just yet, so we needed something that would fit in the current and future sink. This fit the bill. We also wanted something that was durable and stylish. Again, this faucet looks beautiful and feels high-quality. Even our carpenter said he couldn't have gotten a better deal than I did with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper123

customer_reviews.title: This one is working fine. Great customer service from AS
customer_reviews.text: First one made it 3 months and something let go inside so that the head would swing freely from side to side. Contacted American Standard and they immediately sent me a complete new facet. This one is working fine. Great customer service from AS. Hope this one lasts!
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: KITCHEN FAUCET
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement faucet for the kitchen. Has a satin stainless steel look and functions well.
customer_reviews.author: LBC

customer_reviews.title: Good quality faucet
customer_reviews.text: We've been using the very similar Fairbury model for over a year in another location and liked it very much, so when I couldn't find another Fairbury in chrome for a reasonable price I purchased this Colony model. It is meeting expectations, providing easy installation and very smooth flow and temperature control. Some may not care for the flow control being left-right and temperature being backward and forward. But we're used to it and find it works just fine. This is a good quality faucet, so if you like this layout then you probably won't go wrong in buying it.
customer_reviews.author: jcity5

customer_reviews.title: American Standard Kitchen Faucet
customer_reviews.text: Again, I can only say the faucet arrived in very good time. We decided we wanted two identical faucets for the two sinks we had installed in our new kitchen. I found another set that I purchased for our use. We may be putting up a cabin a little later and plan to use the American Standard faucet. It is a big one! It is very pretty! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Al J.

customer_reviews.title: Love my new pullout faucet
customer_reviews.text: Great for kitchen! After the hose attachment stoped working for my kitchen faucet, I considered alternatives. I looked for a pullout type after seeing a gourmet cook friend of mine using one in his home. This feels and looks like excellent quality for the price. I ordered the brushed stainless and it is nice. It cleans easily, was a cinch to install, works well -- perfect. I like that pause, spray and faucet settings can all be toggled while holding with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: Internal leak cannot be repaired
customer_reviews.text: Faucet leaks from internal cold water line. Plumber said it has to be replaced after one month of service. Not only am I out the money for the faucet but it also damaged our brand new sink base cabinet!
customer_reviews.author: brian g

customer_reviews.title: Love this faucet
customer_reviews.text: Was cheaper through Amazon that Home Depot. Love the lines of the faucet...very pretty.
customer_reviews.author: bjordan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice faucet, heftily made and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very nice faucet, heftily made and easy to install. The pull down spout and on/off handle have a quality firm feel to them. I like that if you put it on spray it stays on spray even if you turn the faucet off and back on and the pause button is a nice addition. All the hoses are together on the install and of good quality. The pull down spout stays snugly in place and doesn't droop if properly install with the weight in the correct position.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Goose neck a little too thick, but overall pricing, install and finish is great.
customer_reviews.author: nimrod666

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this product less than 2 months ago and the pull down hose broke. I am the resident (not a random tenant) and I was very careful never to pull too hard. This product is cheap and not worth it at all. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install works great looks better
customer_reviews.text: The hardest was taking out the old Grohe unit that was designed by Germany's supposed best engineers. That was the hardest. This unit is so easy to install as it is really designed to go in like butter I love the look of it and its features. I could not be happier. 45 minutes to get the old unit out this was 15 minutes to install. Love it...
customer_reviews.author: Ken Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Nice faucet, but sprayer hose tends to develop leaks.
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer hose developed a leak after two years of use. The faucet does have a limited lifetime warranty, so after a quick call replacement parts will be here in 5-7 business days.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised; three different models, all damaged
customer_reviews.text: This is the third American Standard faucet I have ordered in the past two months.Colony Pro, Colony Soft, and Arch single handle high arc. All were purchased as new. First one a arrived dented. Second arrived with pull down sprayer that did not remain in the neck. Third one was previously used with water in the hose that had been connected and dirty with white paste like smudges on the sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I have had it installed for a couple of years now. No drips, no noise. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: graybear41

customer_reviews.title: Well built and nice.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice. Fit perfectly. Works great. No problems. Really like it. Classy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy install, much better than the one it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy install, much better than the one it was replacing. Looks good and works very well. Spray is very strong. I liked the reviewer that said the spray is so strong that it splashes everywhere... you can turn the volume of water down..just wanted to say that. The only complaint I have, as noted by others is that it would be nice if the pause button stayed paused until hit again instead of having to hold it. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Outer Banks

customer_reviews.title: parts were missing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the faucet and it stated it came with a deck plate. I have a 3 whole sink and need the deck plate to cover up two whole. Supplier did not provide as stated. I call American Standard and the manufacture is mailing me one. My old faucet is leaking and now have to wait a week before I can install. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Necia Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent construction and quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent construction and quality for the price. American Standard has been around for many decades and it is a superior product. Most commercial establishments use American Standard. It has been a staple in hospitals and like commercial establshisments for years. This actual faucet is excellent for the price. YOU WILL BE VERY PLEASED.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: What a bargain this faucet is. Top quality, easy to install. Ceramic disk valve will never need attention. I made it even better by turning the entire assembly 1/4 turn clockwise, so the valve handle was toward you. I then reversed the water lines so cold was on the right and hot on the left. I also changed the little red-blue button so the blue (cold was on the right and red (hot) was on the left. Now the valve handle can be easily reached and I don't drip water and soap on the escutcheon all the time. Now it's PERFECT
customer_reviews.author: Debby Bond-lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!  Well made!
customer_reviews.text: It's beautiful and well made. Installation was so easy and I didn't need to read the instruction. This was the first time in my entire life that I installed a faucet. I'm happy with this product! My cat loves it too...she just loves drinking from the faucet.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! I thought I was going to have to put in a deeper sink-mine was a standard approximately 7 inch deep sink-but the plumber told me to save my money. I really thought not getting a deeper sink was going to be a problem with splashback-but there is no problem! This fixture looks fantastic, the water has a really smooth flow to it when it comes out, ... it is as described. RECOMMEND!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Opusquest

customer_reviews.title: Parts that goes under the countertop will rust
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this in my kitchen since 2015. Alls well apart from the dangly spray head that others have mentioned. But do note that the parts of the faucet that goes under the countertop WILL rust. Either Ensure that water/damp air never gets to those parts or get a grinder ready if you want to change it out after some years.
customer_reviews.author: atreza

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but it tends to droop.
customer_reviews.text: This was installed in our new deep sink in the garage. When I bought it I wasn't thinking about the one I bought for my kitchen, no issues there. This one works fine but the pull out nozzle tends to droop. If this will be an issue for you buy one with a magnet, like the one in my kitchen...
customer_reviews.author: LaundryNumber 36

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a quality control issue
customer_reviews.text: The faucet came without the needed weight for retractable nozzle. Seems like a quality control issue. I do like the faucet, and just used the weight from the faucet I was replacing, did not contact seller. This faucet is a hard to find height, so it worked well for me. I needed a 13-14" high arch; most of the big box stores' faucets are 16" or more in height. The finish cleans easily, does not retain prints.
customer_reviews.author: Yipiskipi2001

customer_reviews.title: and this was the perfect match. So far no issues with the hose
customer_reviews.text: I've had this faucet for a few months now. We remodeled our kitchen and got a new stainless steel sink, and this was the perfect match. So far no issues with the hose. I like that you can pull it down and also change the spray pattern. Great price too compared to some of the other sinks I looked at.
customer_reviews.author: Lobster bisque

customer_reviews.title: Good faucet, easy to install, but spray is too fine.
customer_reviews.text: Good faucet, but the spray is too fine; at half open, the spray is needle fine and splashes everywhere due to the high pressure. At 3/4 closed, the spray is still fine and doesn't splash, but there's not enough flow. The holes need to be a bit larger to allow more water flow; for now I don't use the spray, maybe I'll dremel out the holes a bit to get a better flow rate.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but Quality!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw some in the big box stores that weren't as nice or sturdy that cost more! No regrets about purchasing this one!! Pair it with Wells Sinkware CMU3318-99-1 Craftsmen Series Stainless Steel Kitchen Sink Package, to get the high end look you're seeking!!
customer_reviews.author: CAWGEORGIA

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: If you're considering this purchase, buy it now. It comes with easy to follow instructions and looks as beautiful as in the picture if not more. Very happy with it. Long hose that retracts right back with ease. It also has a button to shutoff the flow or change from normal spray to a wider spray. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Leitzelar

customer_reviews.title: It's very stylish and i love the spray features
customer_reviews.text: loving the faucet so far! I did not use the plate that came with it. The faucet is sitting flush with my countertop. It's very stylish and i love the spray features. The tubing was not long enough so had to by extensions at Lowe's. ($15)
customer_reviews.author: Emily C. Dupree

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I love my faucet. It took a little while to get used to the way it turns on and off. It seemed counter intuitive to me for some reason. Now that my brain is retrained, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H.

customer_reviews.title: Bad design!
customer_reviews.text: Bad design! The aeration screen on the faucet head cannot be removed. Clogs very easily. I called American Standard...they advised soaking the spray head in vinegar! Design flaw!
customer_reviews.author: MOgmother

customer_reviews.title: Worth it  easy install looks awsome Works better.
customer_reviews.text: easy install looks and works great. not cheap plastic real metal and brass . Sprayer is awesome great design is more a satin chrome seeh than the stainless but looks and blends well.
customer_reviews.author: naftaman

customer_reviews.title: Nice Faucet, check your connections for fitment
customer_reviews.text: Check your connections! This are 3/8th, a lot of wall lines are 1/2. Grab some adapters. Left me with no water for 24 hours to complete the project. Simple install otherwise and the faucet has really improved my kitchen sink's functionality. Hose retracts nicely, the buttons on the head are solid feeling, and feels very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: B. sindelar

customer_reviews.title: Not good experiences
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item a couple of time. However, I found stay water inside of the hose both times. Seems they were return items from other customer and trying to sell as new items.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Park

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Love it. I'd give it 5 stars if the hot/cold knob was tilted forward a bit more, and if the faucet pointed straight down more (it sprays counter/me when in spray mode but not in regular mode), but other than that I am very happy with this. It's a great product for the price point. Very happy. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Schooling

customer_reviews.title: A good one.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought the brushed variety, as the chrome tends toward spots. It helps a bit with the water pressure as well. All things considered, a good investment. Doesn't leak like the old one and will pay for itself in saved water in just a few months.
customer_reviews.author: ladystarhawk

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful faucet, love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this faucet, installation was easy although you will most likely need extensions for the supply lines as they are rather short (approximately 21") and not detachable. About 40% cheaper than retail stores! Very satisfied, would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Nice for 2 years then fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for about two years, then swivel and hose guide broke within the neck. Like other reviewers mention there are no parts to fix so the whole thing had to be replaced. Not worth the hassle; I know things aren’t built to last anymore but a kitchen faucet? Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Faucet Handle In Front...great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice faucet...easy to install...less than 45 minutes. I did put the handle control facing front...usually goes off to right...much better...now you don't drip water on the counter when you turn it off...just remember to reverse the water lines under the sink and turn the blue/red button on the handle the opposite way.
customer_reviews.author: JamesT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install - works as promised
customer_reviews.text: Nothing negative. This is my second (daughter's house and my own). Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: MacIvey

customer_reviews.title: This faucet installed easily. Only issue I had was that one of ...
customer_reviews.text: This faucet installed easily. Only issue I had was that one of the water lines was too short and I had difficulty in finding what I needed to add a line at one of the box stores. The faucet, however, is great. Well recommended, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. T.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The handle broke! We have to replace the whole unit!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Amirani

product_meta.description:
Color:Polished Chrome| Style:Classic DesignClean, soft lines for contemporary kitchens. This one-handle pull down faucet is part of our colony soft collection and complements casual-styled kitchens. Features include a tall swivel spout, pull-down spray with adjustable spray patterns, memory position valving that provides water at your preferred temperature and an ADA-approved lever handle.

AMAZON.COM


AMERICAN STANDARD COLONY PULL-DOWN KITCHEN FAUCET
The Colony kitchen faucet by American Standard is the centerpiece of a professional’s kitchen sink. As the focal point of the sink it shines and continues to throughout its life thanks to a tough finish that resists scratching and tarnishing. Additional modern faucet features such as a ceramic disc valve for drip-free performance and a built-in adjustable pull-down spray keep your kitchen sink the center of attention. The Colony soft pull-down kitchen faucet is currently available in polished chrome, matte black, and stainless steel.

The high-arc nozzle of the Colony kitchen faucet provides easy access to the pull-down sprayer. view larger

The Colony kitchen faucet features a ceramic disc valve to ensure maintenance-free performance.  view larger

Scratch, Tarnish, and Corrosion Resistant Finish In order to hold up to prolonged exposure to water the Colony faucet features brass construction. Brass construction is used because of its natural properties that make it corrosion resistant. 

The natural properties of brass also make it an ideal material for applying colors and finishes. In the case of this American Standard faucet the finish is able to become part of the faucet itself instead of simply an outside coating. This allows the faucet to be scratch and tarnish resistant so the faucet will look new even after prolonged use. 

Drip Free Performance This American Standard faucet features a ceramic disc valve to ensure a lifetime of drip-free performance. The ceramic disc valve keeps your faucet maintenance free and provides smooth handle control, even in extreme temperatures or hard water conditions. The valve is tested to withstand over one million on/off cycles without failure, ensuring old stories of a leaky faucet is a think of the past.

Integrated Sprayer The American Standard Colony kitchen faucet features a pull-down spray for added convenience. The pull-down sprayer has an adjustable spray pattern and even a pause feature. This way water can be directed where it’s needed when it’s needed. 

Safety The American Standard Colony faucet meets the NSF Standard 61/Section 9 and Prop 65 lead requirements set forth by the government. It also has an Americans with Disability Act (ADA) approved handle and memory position valve.

The memory position valve allows you to quickly turn on and off the faucet without worrying about accidently changing the temperature. 

Warranty The Colony faucet features a lifetime function and finish limited warranty. The faucet is warranted to be free from defect in materials or workmanship for as long as the original purchaser owns the home in which it is installed.

About American Standard American Standard Brands give you performance and style in every product. With new lines of consumer design-driven selections, coordinated offerings that match American Standard chinaware collections and styles, as well as exclusive performance features that eliminate leaks, reduce installation time, save water, and add durability and dependability, American Standard products are the choice to improve your home. 

Engineered to look beautiful and function flawlessly, American Standard faucets feature exquisite designs that offer innovative conveniences like pull-out spouts for the bath, easy-to-upgrade shower styles, peace-of-mind safety features, and simpler-than-ever installation and cleaning. 

Shop Amazon’s vast selection to find all kinds of American Standard products for your bathroom and kitchen to include the brands JADO, Porcher, and Crane Plumbing. 

What's in the Box One American Standard Colony Soft 1-handle high-arc kitchen faucet with brass swivel spout.
